Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.view.cli.pages.subparts

Class Island

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.view.cli.pages.subparts.Island
public class Island extends Object
Class used for printing a single island. It always returns to the starting point.
Author:
Riccardo Motta

  • Method Details

    • print

      public static org.fusesource.jansi.Ansi print(int id, Map<HouseColor,Integer> students, TowerType tower, boolean motherNature, boolean ban, boolean next, boolean prev)
      Prints the island.
      Parameters:
      id - Id of the island.
      students - Map of students which are on the island.
      tower - Tower which is on the island (null, otherwise).
      motherNature - Indicates whether Mother Nature is on the island or not.
      ban - Indicates whether the island has been banned or not.
      next - Indicates whether the island is connected to the next one or not.
      prev - Indicates whether the island is connected to the previous one or not.
      Returns:
      The Ansi stream to print to terminal.

    • parseConnections

      private static Map<Island.IslandConnection,Boolean> parseConnections(int id, boolean next, boolean prev)
      Gets the connections from the position (id) and connected neighbours.
      Parameters:
      id - Id of the island.
      next - Next island connection.
      prev - Previous island connection.
      Returns:
      The Map of connections of that island.

    • newLine

      private static org.fusesource.jansi.Ansi newLine()
      Moves the cursor in order to write a new line.
      Returns:
      Ansi stream.

    • resetCursor

      private static org.fusesource.jansi.Ansi resetCursor()
      Moves the cursor to the original position.
      Returns:
      The Ansi stream to print to terminal.

    • defaultForeground

      private static org.fusesource.jansi.Ansi defaultForeground(boolean ban)
      Gets the default foreground for writing things.
      Parameters:
      ban - true if the island has been banned.
      Returns:
      The Ansi stream to print to terminal.

    • parseStudent

      private static org.fusesource.jansi.Ansi parseStudent(int studentsNumber, HouseColor houseColor, boolean ban)
      Parses the number of students of a specific color in order to render them correctly.
      Parameters:
      studentsNumber - The number of students of a specific color.
      houseColor - The color of the students.
      ban - true if the island has been banned.
      Returns:
      The Ansi stream to print to terminal.
